ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: CATALOG=<libref.>catalog] 
      
Specifies the catalog in which you want to store PMENU entries.

[Syntax: DESC 'entry-description'] 
      
Provides a description for the PMENU catalog entries created in the step.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: COLOR=color] 
          
Defines the color of the check box and the text that describes it.

[Syntax: SUBSTITUTE='text-for-substitution'] 
          
Specifies the text that is to be inserted into the command in the DIALOG statement.

Indicates that by default this check box is active. If you use this option, 
then you must specify it immediately after the CHECKBOX keyword.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: RBUTTON <NONE> #line @column 'text-for-selection' <COLOR=color> <SUBSTITUTE='text-for-substitution'>; 

Lists mutually exclusive choices within a dialog box.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: COLOR=color] 
          
Defines the color of the radio button and the text that describes the button.

[Syntax: SUBSTITUTE='text-for-substitution'] 
          
Specifies the text that is to be inserted into the command in the DIALOG statement.

Defines a button that indicates none of the other choices. Defining this button enables the user to ignore
any of the other choices. No characters, including blanks, are inserted into the DIALOG statement.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: TEXT #line @column field-description <ATTR=attribute> <COLOR=color>; 

Specifies text and the input fields for a dialog box.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: LEN=field-length] 
          
Is the length of an input field in which the user can enter information. If the LEN= 
argument is used, then the information entered in the field is inserted into the command 
string of the previous DIALOG statement at field locations prefixed by an at sign (@).
Defines the color for the text or input field characters.
Defines the attribute for the text or input field.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
RADIOBOX DEFAULT=button-number; 

Defines a box that contains mutually exclusive choices within a dialog box.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: DEFAULT=button-number] 
          
Indicates which radio button is the default.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: SELECTION selection 'command-string'; 

Defines a command that is submitted when an item is selected.

Syntax: SEPARATOR; 

Draws a line between items on a menu.

Syntax: SUBMENU submenu-name SAS-file; 

Specifies the SAS file that contains a common submenu associated with an item.

Syntax: DIALOG dialog-box 'command-string field-number-specification'; 

Describes a dialog box that is associated with an item on a menu.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ACCELERATE=name-of-key] 
          
Defines a key sequence that can be used instead of selecting an item. When the user 
presses the key sequence, it has the same effect as selecting the item from the menu 
bar or menu.

[Syntax: DIALOG=dialog-box] 
          
The name of an associated DIALOG statement, which displays a dialog box when the 
user selects this item.

[Syntax: MENU=pull-down-menu] 
          
The name of an associated MENU statement, which displays a menu when the user 
selects this item.

[Syntax: SELECTION=selection] 
          
The name of an associated SELECTION statement, which submits a command when the 
user selects this item.

[Syntax: SUBMENU=submenu] 
          
The name of an associated SUBMENU statement, which displays a pmenu entry when the 
user selects this item.

Indicates that the item is not an active choice in this window. This option is useful 
when you want to define standard lists of items for many windows, but not all items 
are valid in all windows. When this option is set and the user selects the item, no 
action occurs.

[Syntax: HELP='help-text'] 
          
Specifies text that is displayed when the user displays the menu item. For example, 
if you use a mouse to pull down a menu, then position the mouse pointer over the item 
and the text is displayed.

[Syntax: ID=integer] 
          
A value that is used as an identifier for an item in a menu.

[Syntax: MNEMONIC=character] 
          
Underlines the first occurrence of character in the text string that appears on 
the menu. The character must be in the text string.

Provides the ability to place a check box or a radio button next to an item that 
has been selected.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Places a check box button next to an item that has been selected.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Places a radio button next to an item that has been selected.
